*[Bug 18662] Consider signing R binaries + DLLs?*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18662>

Martyn Plummer (<mailto:martyn.plummer@r-project.org|martyn.plummer@r-project.org>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |martyn.plummer@r-project.or
                   |                            |g

--- Comment #1 from Martyn Plummer (<mailto:martyn.plummer@r-project.org|martyn.plummer@r-project.org>) ---
I don't think there is any real advantage to signing the exe and dll files in
the R installation.

Signing the installer has two big advantages for the user:

* Modern browsers will do their best block the download of unsigned binaries.
* When the installer is launched, the user is prompted to verify that they want
it to make changes. It is then useful to verify the provenance of the
installer.

There are not any corresponding blocks or prompts when the user launches R.
